document.docAuthor: Ferreira, Luciane Augusto De Azevedo & Anker, Arthur
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined .
Panama [Caribbean]: 1 male , cl 7.7, cw 7.0 ( MZUSP 33471 ), Bocas del Toro
,
Isla Colón , Boca del Drago , shallow flat with seagrass and coral rubble and coral rocks, depth
0.5–2 m
, associated with
Petrochirus diogenes
, leg. A. Anker ,
01.05.2015
. Extra-limital material
.
USA [Florida]: 3 specimens , cl cw indet. ( FLMNH UF 19582–19584 ), Florida Bay north of
Florida Keys , R
/ V Bellows sta. 7, 81°53.162’W , 24°47.342’N , otter trawl over spongy bottom,
16 m
, associated with hermit crab shell, leg. A. Anker et al .,
07.06.2009
(fcn KEYS-143, KEYS- 144, KEYS-145)
.

Ecology . Intertidal and (more common) subtidal, known depth range: 0–92 m ; in a variety of habitats and on a variety of bottom types , typically on coral or rocky reefs, but also on rocky-sandy flats, near seagrass beds and mangroves; typically associated with larger hermit crabs, especially
Petrochirus diogenes (Linnaeus)
,
Dardanus venosus (H. Milne Edwards)
and
D. fucosus Biffar & Provenzano
, rarely
Paguristes grayi Benedict
and
Pagurus pollicaris Say
; at least in the case of
D. fucosus
, usually found in a symbiotic community that also includes the sea anemone,
Calliactis tricolor (Lesueur)
; more incidentally reported from the giant conch,
Aliger gigas (Linnaeus)
, clinging to the operculum or close to it, from the holothurian
Astichopus multifidus (Sluiter)
, or associated with larger brachyuran crabs, such as
Stenocionops furcatus (Olivier)
and
Dromia erythropus
(Edwards in Catesby); may also be found free-living on sandy, muddy and shell bottoms or in crevices of oyster clusters (Haig 1966; Williams 1984 ;
López-Victoria et al. 2004
;
Lira et al . 2012
; Ferreira & Melo 2016 ;
Mantelatto et al . 2021
and references therein).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 83 .
Porcellana sayana ( Leach, 1820 )
: A–C, male (cl 7.7 mm, cw 7.0 mm) from Bocas del Toro, Panama (MZUSP 33471), dorsal (A), ventral (B) and frontal (C) views [photographs by AA].

FIGURE 84 .
Porcellana sayana ( Leach, 1820 )
: A, B, male (cl 7.7 mm, cw 7.0 mm) from Bocas del Toro, Panama (MZUSP 33471), associated with the hermit crab
Petrochirus diogenes (Linnaeus)
[photographs by AA].

FIGURE 85 .
Porcellana sayana ( Leach, 1820 )
: A, extra-limital specimen, male (cl cw indet.) from Florida Bay, USA (FLMNH UF 19582), dorsal view [photograph by AA]; B, extra-limital specimen, male (cl cw indet.) from Florida, USA (FLMNH UF 28581), dorsal view; C, extra-limital specimen, female (cl cw indet.) from Florida, USA (FLMNH UF 28371), dorsal view [photographs in B and C courtesy of Gustav Paulay].
